answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Since you have had this problem for a long time, I am sure you must have got it investigated. Multiple sclerosis, brain tumors, aneurysm in the brain, demyelinating nerve disorders, Lyme’s disease etc have to be looked into. MRI of brain and upper cervical cord is definitely required. You may also need to test for hypothyroidism and diabetes. I am not sure what MYLEAS stands for.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I am a 32 year old mother of 3.  For as long as I can remember I had trouble with my right side of my body.  More so, My right hand and mainly my fingers.  I cannot really keep my hand straight and it is very painful to try to relax it.  But my smile is crocked and eye is lazy at times.  I have less strength on my ride side.  I am left handed.  I would like to get this addressed because of young children but more importantly my mother died (age of 47) of MYLEAS which before that was misdiagnosed of Mutilpe Scerlois.Can you give me any clues to what this is?Thank you.
title: What is wrong with my right side of body?
